BioMathR 0.6.0
  • Reference

Automatically round numbers

round_smart.Rd

This function automatically rounds numbers so that the results have as few digits as possible, but as many as necessary/desired. It is similar to signif(), but it never alters the part before the decimal separator and also allows a cutoff value for a maximum acceptable number of digits after the decimal separator.

round_smart(x, signif_digits = 1, max_digits = 6)

Arguments

x

A number of vector of numbers

signif_digits

The number of significant digits (default: 1) like in signif(), but only applied to the part after the decimal separator.

  • round_smart(1.0001234, signif_digits = 1) returns 1.0001

  • round_smart(1.0001234, signif_digits = 2) returns 1.00012

max_digits

The maximum number of digits (default: 6) to round to.

  • round_smart(1.0000001234, max_digits = 6) returns 1

  • round_smart(1.0000001234, max_digits = Inf) returns 1.0000001

Examples

library(BioMathR)
library(dplyr)
default_opts <- options()
options(digits = 10, scipen = 999)

before <- data.frame(
  V1 = c(123456, 1234),
  V2 = c(-123, -0.12345),
  V3 = c(1.0012345, 0.1),
  V4 = c(1.1, 0.0012345),
  V5 = c(1.000000012345, 0),
  V6 = c(NA, -5.0018),
  V7 = c(NA_real_, NA_real_)
)

before
#>       V1         V2        V3        V4          V5      V6 V7
#> 1 123456 -123.00000 1.0012345 1.1000000 1.000000012      NA NA
#> 2   1234   -0.12345 0.1000000 0.0012345 0.000000000 -5.0018 NA
mutate(before, across(everything(), ~round_smart(.)))
#>       V1     V2    V3    V4 V5     V6 V7
#> 1 123456 -123.0 1.001 1.100  1     NA NA
#> 2   1234   -0.1 0.100 0.001  0 -5.002 NA
mutate(before, across(everything(), ~round_smart(., signif_digits = 3)))
#>       V1       V2      V3      V4 V5      V6 V7
#> 1 123456 -123.000 1.00123 1.10000  1      NA NA
#> 2   1234   -0.123 0.10000 0.00123  0 -5.0018 NA
mutate(before, across(everything(), ~round_smart(., signif_digits = 3, max_digits = Inf)))
#>       V1       V2      V3      V4          V5      V6 V7
#> 1 123456 -123.000 1.00123 1.10000 1.000000012      NA NA
#> 2   1234   -0.123 0.10000 0.00123 0.000000000 -5.0018 NA
options(default_opts)
